website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for running shoes that are comfortable, supportive, and flexible, the Guide 10s are hard to beat.
pros: Practical running shoes that offer notable flexibility and comfort for the price
Tri-Flex soles deliver reliable traction on most surfaces
Mesh uppers make them feel lightweight and breathable
cons: Sizes tend to run somewhat small, and toe boxes are a bit narrow
Some reports of longevity concerns noted

customer_reviews.title: My Saucony Guide dynasty continues
customer_reviews.text: I've had Saucony Guides since the Guide 5 when they were recommended by a salesperson at a running store. I have always had good results with these and have stuck with them since originally finding them. Some owners have claimed changes in fit over the years. That may be true, but I think they have been subtle at best and still find them to be the best sneaker for me. The Guide 10 is my new running shoe, the Guide 9 is retired to my daily use, and the Guide 8 is the new mowing shoe. 5, 6 and 7 have since been put out to pasture where all great sneakers eventually wind up.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Smith

customer_reviews.title: Too small and tread coming off ...
customer_reviews.text: Size was small and the treads started coming off around the margins (unglued) on both sides at about 70 running miles. First pair of Saucony running shoes that I have NOT been happy with. Maybe just a fluke, but went back to using my old pair (Guide 7 model, which have over 300 miles) - that were the same "size" but fit me right and still have a good solid tread on them. I'll likely go to my local running store next time to get a proper fit and recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable, even when not. Great price!
customer_reviews.text: As a 20 year runner, Saucony is typically a quality trainer brand for me, at a decent price, with a bright color options for me; however, 80 Miles in, one shoe had treads that began peeling off and flapping around! And ripped off! It was along misfit towards toe, 4 rows of them. Saucony would not replace/return. I’ve never seen this happen with this brand, or any running shoe. I still ran about 350 Miles in them, aiming for trails/grass when possible, with dabs of gorilla glue. I’d still buy again, but start using them closer to my purchase date so as to have a stronger case with customer service!
customer_reviews.author: WRC

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed in the Guide 10's, the Guide 9's were better.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately these shoes felt great out of the box, however after less than 20 miles of breaking in the left shoe is uncomfortable to wear. The heel box slips around allowing the insole to sit incorrectly leading to pain across the arch of my foot. After having two pairs of Saucony Guide 9's that each have over 600 miles on them and are still comfortable it is very dissapointing that these haven't held up the same. To make it worse I didn't wear them the first month I had them due to bad weather for running so now I'm just past the return window and out of luck in regards to exchanging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits Just Like the Guide 6 and 8
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why running shoe numbers are changed every year or so. It's always a guess as to whether or not the newest model will have the same fit. Fortunately, these Guides 10s fit ne just like the Guide 6 and Guide 8 shoes that I have worn previously. I like the degree of cushioning and the roomy toe box. I can't rate the arch support because I always replace the insoles with Superfeet Orange. The soles last about 500 miles which isn't great, but the cushioning is pretty much degraded by then anyway. I'll keep buying them as long as they maintain the fit.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Becker

customer_reviews.title: Flexibilty, Durabilty, Light Weight and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion as a Saucony customer for almost 40 years they might produce the most under appreciated and affordable running shoes. Under appreciated perhaps because as customers we don't have to pay for a huge advertising budget. The Guide 10, like most Saucony running shoes is light, flexible and remarkably affordable. Fits as expected for Saucony: 8.5 foot fits in a 9.5 shoe.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: great training shoe, true to size and works great for light over pronators
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! low amount of over-pronation support, quite stiff (compared to the iso hurricane) good traction. good lacing. I really like the design and colors. ran 100km in them, it took a very long period to brake-in, about 40-50km - but once they did they are great. size is true compared to other Saucony shoes, to brooks, Nike and NB. in some brands I take 2e, with this one d works. glad I bought it, one of my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Yoel

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe for heavy, flat footed heel strickers.
customer_reviews.text: Saucony still makes my favorite running shoes. I have a flat foot and have 20 lb overweight so it’s hard to find shoes that control my overpronation, have some cushioning and keep flat arches. With these ones I got 2 for 3. The arches are a little bit too high that they make my feet ache the first 2-3 miles. Then things get better but even though I haven’t gone beyond 5 miles with them I just don’t see them as marathon material just yet. Just due to my incompatibility with the arches. The rest is just fine. Great looks, good lacing, good stability and fair cushioning.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Salinas

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe, though for price paid
customer_reviews.text: Based upon reviews and product description I expected a more cushioned shoe for running. Had to add running insoles to help absorb impact when walking, training and running. I am comparing these to my previous ASIC Gel Nimbus shoes, maybe unfairly due to price / performance between the two shoe brands and models. Good shoe, though for price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne R.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, feel a little small
customer_reviews.text: Very comfy shoe, I got the same size as my previous shoes (Saucony Guide 9's) and they do feel significantly tighter across the top. I'm not sure if they just need to stretch out more, but I can feel a difference. That being said, they provide a lot of support, especially in my arch. Great shoes so far!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: A little tight fitting.  Go for a half size larger. Awesome shoe otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe after taking almost two weeks researching a good sneaker for my running needs. I did see some reviews saying the I should choose a half size larger. I found a seller on through Amazon that was selling my actual size at a price that was very affordable for me. I chose not to go a half size larger, partially because of price and color. The shoes are snug and firm fitting. Very comfortable. Can hardly feel the pavement when I run.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bill

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality for the Price. Can't Be Beat.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for the price. I used to wear Gel Kayanos and when they went through many changes, they just didn't fit my feet right. These shoes feel great right out of the box. Usually I will wear them a few days at work before lacing them up for a run. I do local races and train 5-6 days a week of 6+ miles at a time. These shoes do not wear out quickly and are worth every penny. I would recommend them to any type of runner who needs a little more stability without the added bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Short

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, laces suck.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy shoe, fits well from heel to toe. I wear a size 16, have high arches, and suffer from plantar fasciitis. This shoe make my feet feel as well as can be expected when on my feet for long periods of time at work. My only beef is the shoe laces suck. They seem elasticy and are thin.
customer_reviews.author: R. Leabo

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of Guide 8s many years ago and they are still kicking. They aren't pretty, but they are now my work outside shoes. I have never been able to find a more comfortable shoe. I've bought Nike's, Puma's, New Balance, etc, none of them are as comfortable as this shoe. So I had to just buy another pair. And these are just as good as my sturdy old Guide 8s
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Of The Nati

customer_reviews.title: Good for flat feet. Nice arch support.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has flat arches but walks on the outer edge of his feet so the sides of his shoes wear out quickly (he’s in excellent shape it’s just how his foot strikes the ground). Anyway, he needs support for his joints while running and this cushions his foot well to lessen the road shock.
customer_reviews.author: RKB

customer_reviews.title: just okay
customer_reviews.text: I had the guide 7 (owned 3 different pairs) , really liked those then went to the guide 9's didn't like those at all as they took the arch out of the shoe. The Guide 10's are just okay they are not great, made my toe box go numb. Not sure if Saucony changed where they are being manufactured or not, but they are starting to go down hill. I ordered the Omni this go around lets see if I'm changing brands...
customer_reviews.author: Kryme2sleep

customer_reviews.title: Fit and feel is similar to the Guide 9
customer_reviews.text: It was time to make sure that I had a replacement for my Guide 9. When I read reviews of the Guide ISO and also saw a pair in real life, I realized that the ISO reflected a fairly significant redesign. Therefore I searched for Guide 10. The Guide 10 fits and feels almost exactly like the Guide 9 to me. Happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Switch from brooks ravinas to these
customer_reviews.text: I have worn brooks for the last 5 years, mainly the ravinas, but lately I haven’t been happy with their quality. The rubber was separating very early and they just didnt feel right. I read a lot of reviews and people that wore ravinas also wor these. So I switched and am very happy. Haven’t gone on a good run with them yet, but they feel very secure, sturdy and comfortable! A good amount of cushion for my 200lbs frame. I’m excited! I would highly recommend for anyone else that has been disappointed with Brooks lately.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Runs Large, But Awesome Regardless
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews stating to go up a size, I went up one and a half. In other words, I ordered a size 10 for my 8.5 feet. I'm definitely grateful for the reviewers as these run way larger than they should. Thus, 10 is perfect for my 8.5 feet (maybe could have gotten away with 9.5). I've ran a 5k with them with no problem and get compliments left and right. I highly recommend these shoes; just make sure you go up a least a full size.
customer_reviews.author: Where Are My Droids?

customer_reviews.title: Quality surpasses price.  You get more than what you paid for.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my older running shoes with these and they are by far much more effective with the horrendous plantar fasciitis I develop when running on pavement versus a treadmill in the gym. Given I don't have a large budget for running sneakers I got these during cyber Monday and now I know why people spend the money. I'm not buying cheep again. Also, the hard rubber compound of the sole have proven to be great for longevity. If your running 3-5 times a week like I am I would buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed shoe with good support and cushioning
customer_reviews.text: The shoe will meet my needs as a moderate non competitive distance runner. Appears to be well constructed, provides good support and cushioning. The toe box seems a little smaller than other Saucony shoes I have worn but I should be able to loosen the laces enough to make them comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Very Affordable and Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are the least expensive running shoes (which, at 70 years old I use for walking) I have bought in a long time. But I find them very comfortable, supportive and attractive as well. Have put only maybe 10 miles on them since I got them, but, so far, I am very favorably impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son's a distance runner & love Saucony Guide.
customer_reviews.text: My son's a distance runner and Saucony Guide is his shoe of choice. Everyone's feet are different so you get what fit's you. They last a good while... He used to use New Balance but those lasted him maybe 3 months of running.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable and durable.
customer_reviews.text: When I wear these shoes, I like to imagine that they were specially crafted by Hephaestus himself for Hermes, but were stolen by Saucony before he could add the wings. I can't say enough good things about these shoes. Its my second pair. They fit me perfectly and they are very durable. I've used this pair daily for over 6 months now and they still look and feel brand new. Really recommend trying these shoes out.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas M.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Please go into a running store and get properly sized before buying any running shoes online. Once you do that, come back onto Amazon and buy the shoes instead. These are great shoes. They provide minimal cushioning but not minimalistic. Fit very well through the mid-sole. Great breathability because of the mesh. Wear shows after ~6-8 months especially fraying in the mesh.
customer_reviews.author: C H

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Guide series are the best shoes for me
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wearing the Saucony Guide series of running shoes for almost 20 yrs. I run approx 4-5 miles a day. Before I learned about these shoes, I tried New Balance, ASICS, Puma, etc, Trying to find that “perfect shoe”. I even had mild plantar fasciitis. After discovering the Saucony Guide series-beginning with the 5, I’ve never had any issues with plantar fasciitis, or any other running comfort issues. The 10’s are great as usual and these are my 2nd pair.
customer_reviews.author: Waide Harris

customer_reviews.title: Best version of the Guide in a number of years.
customer_reviews.text: Best version of the Guide in a number of years. Back to the fit of years ago. Seems like there is a bit more material on the side of the shoe, but in my opinion, this just adds to the stability. Great colors, too.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: I have several pairs of Guide 10s that I have loved and these were painful to run in after a ...
customer_reviews.text: I run 50-60 miles per week so I replace my shoes every month or two. I have several pairs of Guide 10s that I have loved and these were painful to run in after a half mile so when I got home I looked closely and these were visibly different from a pair of Guide 10s that I bought at a running store. The label was different, the treads did not exactly match and the 9.5 US I ordered definitely felt much smaller than my other 9.5 Guide 10s. There may be a good explanation why they don't match the shoes sold in stores but it was definitely a let down.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accidentally the Right Size
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe. My previous Saucony running shoes size 11 1/2 were too large (needed xtra inner soles); another pair size 11 were also a bit too large; for these shoes I almost tried size 10 1/2 but glad I didn't since these size 11's were a bit smaller than the previous size 11's and just right (although I still put in a heel pad). I guess it depends on the particular shoe. Next time I will order size 10 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: David Austin

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes.  This is my second pair!
customer_reviews.text: I liked these shoes so much this is my second pair! The prior pair I had lasted for a little over a year before I decided to replace them. The old pair finally gave out in two places - the inner fabric near the heal (wore away from use) and the tread on one of the soles started to delam (Just a tiny bit). The only thing that I had to do to make the initial pair fit well was to use a marathoners lace. The replacement pair doesn't yet seem to need that, though, to keep my foot secure in there. I am a slightly over-pronated runner
customer_reviews.author: CLINTON H ASHER

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite pair of running shoes ive found
customer_reviews.text: I have a slightly narrow foot, but am comfortable wearing normal width shoes. This is my third pair at least of these shoes. I run about 1,000 miles or more per year and these keep up with me very nicely. Every once in a while I try something else, but I keep coming back to these. Great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan R

customer_reviews.title: A+ shoe for moderate overpronation
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using a Saucony Guide, and it will be in my running shoe rotation for years to come. It's very comfortable to wear and gives a surprisingly springy response for how much cushioning it has. I am a moderate overpronator, and the Guide 10 offers the perfect amount of support. Plus it looks really nice!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Fits as expected and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Fits great, VERY comfortable. Under intense conditions, it lasts 6 months -- that's worn every day, climbing on things, hills, snow, street, absolutely everything. feels a little bit better than the Guide 9s did. These are for mild pronators!!!! If you either have no pronation or a sever one, these are not the shoes for you!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Converted from Asics. Love Saucony.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair of Guide 10s that I have purchased. I have a little over 200 miles on my other pair including 35 trail miles. Awesome road running shoe, not a trail shoe. It has a wide toe box and the mesh upper hugs your foot like a sock. The heel lock works well and keeps my foot planted in the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, looks great
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe. This is my second pair of Saucony Guide 10s. I wore the last ones out after logging 450 miles in them. These felt great right out of the box and have continued to feel great as I've broken them in. I was concerned switching colors from the blue ones to these yellow ones that they might fit differently, as the dye can sometimes affect fit in my experience. That was not an issue. They fit perfectly. Love them. Will buy again in another 450 miles.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, top part has lacerations after 250 miles of use.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes and have warn these for the last 5 pairs of running shoes. After 250 miles, they start to lacerate on the front edges near my toes. I still like them, I just realize that i have to buy them every couple hundred miles (instead of the recommended 500).
customer_reviews.author: Taylor J.

customer_reviews.title: Possibly defective
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of Saucony Guide and I am seriously disappointed. I dont know if its the new design or a defect or both, but after about 3 miles in my run I start to notice an odd lump in my right foot on the outside edge. Unfortunately Ive put about 30 miles on these shoes already or Id return them.
customer_reviews.author: Xanous

customer_reviews.title: Narrow Toe Box
customer_reviews.text: I've worn various editions of the Saucony Guide series and this one is the first that didn't work out. The toe box is too narrow for me and even ordering a full size bigger didn't help. I was disappointed that I had to return them. I'll stick with my Omni 15s.
customer_reviews.author: BCB

customer_reviews.title: Why you plan to purchase running shoes like these shoes?!?
customer_reviews.text: Amazing running shoes! This is my 3rd pair of the Guide 10. Ive had hereditary knee issues in the past that were exacerbated by poor running shoes. I starting walking/jogging/running again mainly to get back into shape, stay somewhat healthy (with a moderately good diet), and stay alive to watch my kids grow. These shoes are incredible. I hope to purchase 2 more pairs soon!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great for Running
customer_reviews.text: These are great for running, which I do 3 day a week. Light well made and wear out in relatively good time about 5-8 months before your knees tell you time for a new pair. Tried some Hoka ones since they looked very well made- too heavy for me for running. These feel as light as pumas and atras. Too bad they are getting harder to find. Tried some Saucony Iso's, no bueno
customer_reviews.author: Roberto P.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap sole material
customer_reviews.text: From my understanding this item is for heavy weight men’s shoes. The souls was very poorly made. being a bigger gentleman was expecting for it to hold up not the truth within a week the sole were compressed and trashed for $100 wasn’t worth the money. But will admit everything else was ok look, fit, and design but if I can’t use the shoe after a week cause the Shoe sole is compressed not worth my money
customer_reviews.author: courtney matthew treadaway

customer_reviews.title: I recommend that anyone looking for a running shoe be fitted ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the Saucony Guide model for a number of years. I recommend that anyone looking for a running shoe be fitted first at a runner's store in your local area. This will help you understand your feet and the brand you choose. What is your foot gait, foot arch, cushing needs, etc. Each brand fits differently too. Once you have a good shoe, you can purchase on a recurring frequency from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Switched to Nike
customer_reviews.text: Long time Saucony fan but disappointed with how quickly the inner upper heal wore out -2 stars. The rest of the shoe was great but it became too painful to continue wearing. Bought a pair of Nikes to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as past versions....
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried many different iterations of this model... This style doesn’t seem as comfortable as past versions. It also is wearing very quickly on the inner heel/achilles area. The fabric is wearing through after only minor usage.
customer_reviews.author: Pk

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes colorful footwear and was very excited to get these. When the arrived, they were awesome, but when he tried them on, he could not even get his feet inside of them. We ordered the size he has worn for years and still wears, but these were incredibly small. We returned them and ordered some of the same size for another brand name and fit as expected, comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Hinther

customer_reviews.title: Seems like much ado about not much...
customer_reviews.text: Really wanted to like from very good press. However: Much too lightweight for stability shoe. Fit is a bit tight in width. Seems like much ado about not much... Perhaps young speedsters will appreciate more than this aging runner/jogger. Unfortunately, not for me
customer_reviews.author: DESERT-TEK

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Have been an Asics only runner for years. IMO their quality has become inconsistent over the past year. I thought I would at least try something else. Picked up the Saucony Guide 10's on deal of the day and I must say they are remarkable in terms of fit and comfort. The reason for four stars is I don't know about the durability. I
customer_reviews.author: Scott R. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Works well for me
customer_reviews.text: These are always good shoes. I just wish they would continue to make the same model. I don’t like changing from something that I know works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Reid Deschand

customer_reviews.title: Road ready trainer right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I have previously bought and enjoyed the Guide 8 and 9's. I was currently running on Mizuno Wave Inspire 12's. I found the Guide 10's to be a better value then purchasing another pair of Mizuno's. I ran 8 miles, right out of the box. Two days later I ran 16. The shoes are comfortable and feel lighter than the Miz WI 12's. I have a narrow foot so any change to the toe box did not effect me. I plan to continue wearing the shoes for my Boston Bound training and the race. Good shoe and value. Run on!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Wide is not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet, but not super wide. I typically go with a 2E Brooks Adrenaline, but thought I'd give the Saucony's a try. They only offer one wide option, and it's not wide enough. The shoe was comfortable, but it was just a bit too snug. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Liapis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, but a bit smaller (as I had seen ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, wore them to break in for a concert and then one 4 mile run. Comfortable, but a bit smaller (as I had seen the toe box area is a bit smaller than other 10.5 sized Saucony's but okay with this as it is more firm up front with out having to really "wrench-down" on the laces to get the toe and mid-foot the way I like it) First run breaking in is okay, comfy, good padding and will enjoy using these for my first marathon in a month. Bright and nice looking too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Correct size
customer_reviews.text: We sent the shoe back bc of a size too small and where now charged anyway. I can’t find another way for contact! Pls. note that shoes where returned a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite runners I use daily for work.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite running shoes. Not only used for running though. They are stylish enough for casual times and you can be on you feet for hours with these shoes. Moderate stability support is just enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe with a somewhat different shoe design.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of the Guide 10’s. Iv’e had them for 10 days now and they are working out great. Perfect fit and feeling very comfortable on my feet. A somewhat different arch design from my previous Guide shoes, but still provides stability and great heel/arch/toe support. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: jerryz

customer_reviews.title: Good support and cushioning
customer_reviews.text: These are great running shoes. The fit is perfect and they're well cushioned. If you like barefoot or minimal running, these probably aren't the shoes for you. The hold up great and look good even after running during the winter snow season in them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, seem to be holding up well, good for marathon training.
customer_reviews.text: I'm training for a marathon and these are really good finds. The price was right, fit like any other Saucony shoe, and are comfortable for running many miles. I've had them for ~1.5 months of marathon distance and speed training and so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Bendy (Ben and Randy)

customer_reviews.title: Box toe was narrower fit than the Cohensions.
customer_reviews.text: I've always had to get one full size up with my Saucony running shoes. These 10.5 were the right length but for these Guide 10s I also needed a wider width. The box toe was narrow. My past 6 pairs of Cohesions were all medium width but I needed wider width with the Guide 10s. Reordered for same size but wider box toe.
customer_reviews.author: Milo

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable. On my third pair
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair. I love these shows. Great for walking, running, and helps with plantar fascitis
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A

customer_reviews.title: Great sneaker for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 14 year old son who has very large and flat feet. His feet also tend to run wide sized, as many people with flat feet do. I bought him a 15 regular and he states they are amazing, very comfortable and supportive. He normally wore Brooks Beast or Suacomy Stability, but neither shoe is made anymore, so this has been a great substitute for a guy with hard to find size and needs
customer_reviews.author: Victoria McKinley-Kimball

customer_reviews.title: Shoes fit but ...
customer_reviews.text: My heel wore holes into the back of the shoe. Returned - got sized up locally and I was fitted with a different shoe (Mizuno). That being said - this shoe may fit someone else just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Loved Guide 7 ... this feels as good
customer_reviews.text: I got a lot of life out of my Guide 7. Tried switching to a less supportive Brooks based on salesman feedback and wasn't satisfied. I feel like this new shoe will treat me well.
customer_reviews.author: Bertram Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great arch support. These running shoes are more stiff than Saucony's new models, but it has far superior arch support. Great for everyday wear.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Love Saucony
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to Saucony in London when my Nikes blew out. I walk heavy on my heels and the lady said Saucony are great for that so I bought them and have been sold on the brand ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought them
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes I've ever owned. Fit is comfortable, great arch support. Extraordinarily rugged shoes; I run 50 miles/week, and bought a new pair after 2 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this product line and the Guide 10s have been ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this product line and the Guide 10s have been my favorite yet. 10.5 wide and fits perfect. My last pair *guide 8) had an issue with squeezing in the toe box, not enough to return but I felt they were a bit worse than the 6s or 7s. These 10s are prefect again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It seems Saucony is getting a little smaller in sizing ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems Saucony is getting a little smaller in sizing, as of late. Front of foot seems more squeezed now, but I only use for walking/casual wear, so I can accept it. Get a LOT of comments/compliments from people - even strangers, concerning glow-in-dark nature of coloring. lol
customer_reviews.author: Vijabe

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable shoe.  No break-in time needed.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. No break-in time needed. 6 miles out of the box. As recommended by running store about this and other 2017-2018 models, I had to get a 1/2 larger and 1 size up wider. Normally I am not even aware I have the shoes on. Let's see how many miles I came get on them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves them. Best shoes for overweight people like my husband and I.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fits as expected, good price.
customer_reviews.text: I just got them for Christmas and wore them for only a few hours but the quality seems very good. I’ve had a pair before these that I paid a lot more for at a running store these seem just as good and fit just as good. I would’ve given 5 stars but I’ve only worn them for a few hours. So far, really good shoes for a good price though!
customer_reviews.author: Trish Krauskopf

customer_reviews.title: Good running shoe with sufficient support
customer_reviews.text: High quality shoe, price ok. Check sizing instructions and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: GoForFun

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I've put maybe 50 miles on these since I received them, including a long run of 20 miles. So far, so good. A nice compromise between light weight and stability. I'll be doing a Marathon in 2 weeks, so we'll see how they work for that.
customer_reviews.author: scottincarmel

customer_reviews.title: It was present for my boyfriend
customer_reviews.text: He was suprised how great they fit and very light weight too.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Fit a little small, but very comfy
customer_reviews.text: I use these for both training and triathlon, very comfortable shoes, but they do usually fit a little smaller compared to other brands
customer_reviews.author: Mat

customer_reviews.title: Great sneaker for plantar fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product, fit and comfort as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: DDJULY4

customer_reviews.title: Buy Nike's
customer_reviews.text: Less than three months old and they have developed holes in the ankle support. As you can see from the pictures, the shoes are otherwise in good shape. I run 10 to 15 miles a week on either a treadmill or paved roads. Save yourself the headache and buy Nike's.
customer_reviews.author: Travis B Purdy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Quality
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed in this shoe. I have been a long time wearer of Saucony Men's Guide running shoes. I wore the Guide 9 with no issues for years. When the Guide 10 came out, I was excited to try them. For whatever reason, they fit smaller. I had to go up a size. Then, within 30 days, the sole started to fall apart (the same spot on both shoes, leading me to believe it is a defect. Also, a rip appeared in the webbing near the outside of my foot. 20 days after the rip appeared, this shoe is now completely blown out and unwearable. Horrible quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great initial impression
customer_reviews.text: Tough to find good stable shoes so tried my first pair of Saucony running shoes. They have delivered so far and not irritating my knees as some of the cheaper versions have. Will update after many more miles but initial impression is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe but don't get the gray/red
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are comfortable and well-made. Ordering a half size up per the reviews was the right choice. I wouldn't get the gray/red version (which is mysteriously labeled as "Grey Navy" here) next time, though: the red color bleeds badly onto socks and permanently stains them.
customer_reviews.author: A Kantor

customer_reviews.title: This particular model has made me a my shins very happy, I would add that I do burn through ...
customer_reviews.text: Flat footed so a running shoe with support is a must. I'm in the military and spend quite a bit of my time on the run conditioning so the quality of the support is important. This particular model has made me a my shins very happy, I would add that I do burn through them every 6 months however I get a lot of mileage from them.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. I am an avid runner and was desperate to find a daily driver to succeed my Nike Structure 17’s. These surpassed all the Nike Structure 18-21, Nike Lunarglide 8, and the ASICS Kayano 23’s.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Check the needs of your feet regarding design and support. Different styles are designed for different needs.
customer_reviews.text: The consistent fit is the reason that this is about my seventh pair of Saucony sneakers. There are two models that provide excellent arch support - this is one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Don C.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Good support. Lightweight. A little clunky sounding when I wear them on the hardwood floor however.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Mantis Toboggan M.D.

customer_reviews.title: This fits perfectly in a sneaker size 9 Wide. ...
customer_reviews.text: This fits perfectly in a sneaker size 9 Wide. My Brannock size is US 8E or 8.5D depending on who is measuring. These feel light.
customer_reviews.author: jcdot

customer_reviews.title: Poor liner construction - useless after 40 miles
customer_reviews.text: Loved these shoes out of the box - great fit, soft landing, light, and just the right amount of stability. Within two months and 40-ish miles, the lining material at my heels had started to fray and quickly deteriorated, leaving holes and exposing a rough plastic. I soon had terrible blisters and while the rest of the shoe is in fine shape, they are unwearable. I’ve had dozens of pairs of running shoes (including earlier models of Guide) and never had this problem. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for running.
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes. This is my second pair. Had the Guide 9, moved to Guide 10. These are even better. I have flat feet and pronation. I can run much better and longer with these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. McFly

customer_reviews.title: Moderate stability shoe with great cushioning.
customer_reviews.text: Good cushioning with light to moderate stability support, exactly as intended. I alternate between the GUIDE and the neutral support Saucony Triumph ISO.
customer_reviews.author: Ama Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes; wrong color
customer_reviews.text: Good quality shoe. Only issue is the wrong color showed up. I received the all black and gray version. Unfortunately, I needed shoes right away and could not deal with returns; etc.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: Saucony makes a great shoe. Hands downs.
customer_reviews.text: Having run many marathons and halves and after trying them all from Nike,Reebok,asics,to New Balance. Saucony is my choice for an awesome running shoe. Trust no other.
customer_reviews.author: keith farmer

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: overall good shoes, little tighter in the toe box than previous versions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are comfortable and very stable on runs ranging from two to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the second pair of Guide 10's I've bought. They are comfortable and very stable on runs ranging from two to ten miles, I can't speak for any longer distances but these shoes are great and I'll probably buy another pair eventually.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: and the shoe fits perfect. I have had a number of the Glides
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to a review, I purchased a 1/2 size larger than normal, and the shoe fits perfect. I have had a number of the Glides, from version 6 to 10...this shoe is very similar than previous versions.. the upper sole seems fit better than previous versions, might be the lacing patterns.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the Guide 10's do not disappoint. They also seem to be better built
customer_reviews.text: I was previously wearing the Guide 9's, the Guide 10's do not disappoint. They also seem to be better built, I'm not having any of the same issues with the seams or soles coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Guide 10 feel as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of Saucony Guide 10 running shoes. I was happy with the first pair, and the 2nd feel as expected. No blisters or whatever, even though I used them immediately for a 10km run. I'm running on normal roads (concrete, asphalt & tiles) and in the countryside (gravel, dirt, grass, ...).
customer_reviews.author: Willem Temmerman

customer_reviews.title: Ran small and narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Only wore them around the house, were too narrow and felt like they ran small. My old shoes where Saucony hurricane ISO and they fit great. Even though they ran small and I returned them. They did feel like they had great cushion.
customer_reviews.author: Westernburbs

customer_reviews.title: great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: love these shoes for running. My second pair of this type, and very happy with both pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Petra

customer_reviews.title: Believe me these are great shoes, perfect cushioning and support
customer_reviews.text: I have marathons, ultra marathons and finished the Ironman in Kona. Believe me these are great shoes, perfect cushioning and support. I will buy them again when I wear out my present pair.
customer_reviews.author: No Public name

customer_reviews.title: Light and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. Comfortable, a little bit wider at the ball of the foot, so better for slightly wider feet; at least for me. They're light and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great structured running shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for those with pronation. Good looking and comfortable. I have another pair of a different color and the size is consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Justice1

customer_reviews.title: Tread coming loose
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Saucony running shoes for over 7 years and have enjoyed every pair. So much so, I have not looked at another brand since. The tread began falling off of these within 2 weeks of ordering my first pair of Guide 10s. Amazon was great and exchanged them with no hassle. The second pair, in less than 2 months, has the tread falling off just like the first. It appears I’m outside the return window and am stuck with shoes that have the tread falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This shoe for him is the best fit and comfort for his feet
customer_reviews.text: The Saconys are for my husband. This shoe for him is the best fit and comfort for his feet. Also, we think the price is very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: BBuzz

product_meta.title: Saucony Men's Guide 10 Running Shoes
product_meta.description:
The Guide continues to outpace the pack by driving innovation with each update. The 10th edition delivers the ideal guide running experience with a streamlined midsole design, dynamic engineered mesh upper and tri-flex outsole with enhanced forefoot flexibility. Fast feels a little faster in the Guide 10.

Saucony is among the most respected names in running shoes. We offer a wide range of running and walking shoes, each with the Saucony trademark fit, feel and performance. We've spent years studying the biomechanics of top athletes. Our goal? To develop creatively engineered systems that maximize your performance in your specific activity, allowing you to focus on the activity instead of the equipment. From our studies have come many innovative Saucony concepts. Advanced technologies-like Grid, the first sole-based stability and cushioning system--provide an advantage to athletes of all types.
feature_bullets: Shaft measures approximately low-top from arch
Light Stability for runners looking for extra support
Engineered mesh upper for dynamic lightweight fit
FLEXFILM, EVERUN Top sole Construction, Tri-Flex Outsole Design, Engineered Mesh Upper
FLEXFILM, EVERUN Top sole Construction, Tri-Flex Outsole Design, Engineered Mesh Upper
